definition: lit. the soft can subdue the hard
soft/flexible/supple/yielding/rho (Greek letter Ρρ)
surname Neng
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
variant of 剋|克[ke4]
to scold/to beat
hard/firm/strong/just/barely/exactly

sentences.english: Yes, it is 'the soft skills that cut diamonds' that can save you.
sentences.chinese: 是的，这正是“柔能克刚”，能救你于水火的技巧。

definition: to use softness to conquer strength (idiom)
can bow and submit, or can stand tall (idiom, from Book of Changes); ready to give and take/flexible
can bow and submit, or can stand tall (idiom, from Book of Changes); ready to give and take/flexible
lit. a needle concealed in silk floss (idiom)/fig. ruthless character behind a gentle appearance/a wolf in sheep's clothing/an iron fist in a velvet glove
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
lit. one object bests another object/every item has a weakness (idiom)/there is a rock to every scissor, a scissor to every paper, and a paper to every rock
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
firm/unyielding
lit. four ounces can move a thousand catties (idiom)/fig. to achieve much with little effort
a just cause enjoys abundant support (idiom); those upholding justice will find help all around
A leader can submit or can stand tall as required./ready to give and take/flexible
pinyin: da4 zhang4 fu5 neng2 qu1 neng2 shen1

definition: using the weak to defeat the strong (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
however strong you are, there is always someone stronger (idiom)/there is always sth more to learn/never be satisfied to rest on your laurels/there is no room for complacency
pinyin: qiang2 zhong1 zi4 you3 qiang2 zhong1 shou3

definition: place sb on a field of death and he will fight to live (idiom based on Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3]); to fight desperately when confronting mortal danger/fig. to find a way out of an impasse
pinyin: zhi4 zhi1 si3 di4 er2 hou4 sheng1

definition: a great hero may appear timid (idiom); the really brave person remains level-headed
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
